page.title: 21Arthur Cross, Burbage historian. Origins of the "Croft"
page.content: This building now much altered was the original "Moat House", built by the Wightman family in the early eighteenth century, this was sold to a Mr Wells in 1750 a Coventry wine merchant, who owned the property until the early victorian period when the rectory now the "Moat House residential home" was built on the original Moat House garden
